q1.hybrid: The servicemen and women killed in Iraq are spoken about in the movie from Moore's hometown, Flint, Michigan.

q3.vectordb: Moore compliments those serving in the U.S. military.
q3.hybrid: Moore compliments those serving in the U.S. military.

q4.question: What does Moore suggest?
q4.answer: ['that atrocities will occur in Iraq and shows footage depicting U.S. abuse of prisoners.', 'Moore suggests the Iraq war was based on a lie']
q4.recall: Moore suggests that the 2000 presidential election was influenced by Fox News Channel. He alleges that the U.S. government evacuated members of the bin Laden family after 9/11 without investigation. Moore also examines George W. Bush's Air National Guard service record and claims his oil well attempts were funded by the Saudis and bin Laden family. He alleges that the Bush administration induced fear among Americans after 9/11 to gain support for the war in Afghanistan. Moore suggests that, because the war was based on a lie, atrocities will occur, and shows footage depicting U.S. abuse of prisoners. Because Moore was tired of seeing people like Lila Lipscomb suffer, and after discovering that only one member of Congress has a child serving in Iraq, he distributes armed services enrollment information to various members of Congress and suggests that they enlist their children. Tying together several themes and points, Moore compliments those serving in the U.S. military.
q4.vectordb: Moore suggests that the friends and political allies of George W. Bush at Fox News Channel tilted the presidential election of 2000, the handling of the voting controversy in Florida constituted election fraud, and the Bush administration is not working for the best interests of Americans. He also suggests ulterior motives for the War in Afghanistan and that the Bush administration induced a climate of fear among the American population through the mass media after the 9/11 attacks. Additionally, Moore alleges that the United States Government evacuated members of the bin Laden family on a secret flight shortly after the 9/11 attacks without subjecting them to any form of investigation. He also examines George W. Bush's Air National Guard service record and alleges conflicts of interest in his dry-hole oil well attempts. Moore further discusses the Iraq War and the impact on the citizens of Iraq, as well as the targeting of low-income neighborhoods in Flint, Michigan by military recruiters. He suggests that atrocities will occur due to the war being based on a lie and shows footage depicting U.S. abuse of prisoners. Moore also highlights the sacrifice of those serving in the U.S. military and questions the purpose of the war. He distributes armed services enrollment information to members of Congress and suggests that they enlist their children. Moore concludes by stating that the lower class of America are always the first to join the army and defend the nation, and that valuable troops should not be sent to risk their lives unless absolutely necessary.
q4.hybrid: Moore suggests that the friends and political allies of George W. Bush at Fox News Channel tilted the presidential election of 2000, the handling of the voting controversy in Florida constituted election fraud, and the Bush administration is not working for the best interests of Americans. He also suggests ulterior motives for the War in Afghanistan and that the Bush administration induced a climate of fear among the American population through the mass media after the 9/11 attacks. Additionally, Moore alleges that the United States Government evacuated members of the bin Laden family on a secret flight shortly after the 9/11 attacks without subjecting them to any form of investigation. He also examines George W. Bush's Air National Guard service record and alleges conflicts of interest in his dry-hole oil well attempts. Moore further discusses the Iraq War and the impact on the citizens of Iraq, as well as the targeting of low-income neighborhoods in Flint, Michigan by military recruiters. He suggests that atrocities will occur due to the war being based on a lie and shows footage depicting U.S. abuse of prisoners. Moore also highlights the sacrifice of those serving in the U.S. military and questions the purpose of the war. He distributes armed services enrollment information to members of Congress and suggests that they enlist their children. Moore concludes by stating that the lower class of America are always the first to join the army and defend the nation, and that valuable troops should not be sent to risk their lives unless absolutely necessary.

q11.question: What was Bush informed?
q11.answer: ['He was informed of the 9/11 attacks - when the planes hit the towers.', 'of the first plane hitting the World Trade Center']
q11.recall: Bush was informed about the ulterior motives for the War in Afghanistan, including the possibility of a natural gas pipeline being laid through Afghanistan to the Indian Ocean.
q11.vectordb: George W. Bush was informed of the first plane hitting the World Trade Center on his way to an elementary school. He was then shown sitting in a Florida classroom with kids. When told that a second plane has hit the World Trade Center and that the nation is "under attack," Bush seems wary but calmly continues reading 'The Pet Goat' to the kids. He continued reading for nearly seven minutes before leaving the school.
q11.hybrid: Bush was informed about the ulterior motives for the War in Afghanistan, including the possibility of a natural gas pipeline being laid through Afghanistan to the Indian Ocean.
